page.title: 01LANDSCAPE
page.content:
{LANDSCAPE }(NEWCASTLETON) "When brightly shines the summer sun, Oot over the hills and plain, And sweetly frae the lift abune, Is heard the laverocks strain, I love tae wander forth ma'sel, Where lowin'cattle roam, And view the spot l love so well, My native Copshawholm".
Newcastleton is the most southern part of{Roxburghshire}The River Liddle runs along the side of Newcastleton or the more familar name of Copshawholm. Newcastleton is 25 miles from Carlisle,21miles from Hawick,10 miles from Canonbie and 16 miles from Langholm (or 10 miles across the hills). Newcastleton is near Kielder Water or you can go to the Teviotdale Leisure Centre at Hawick.
